result.execSummary:
The defendant Denise J. Varboncoeur was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed/stayed with huber, consecutive to 15CM139 and 15CM140.
Consecutive to: 15CM139 and 15CM140

Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any educational or treatment programs ordered by the agent.

Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations of counselor.

Pay court costs and costs of the action.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Denise J. Varboncoeur
Current: 975 W Seminary St Apt 241, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 07-25-2016)
Prior: 975 West Seminary Street Apt. 241, Richland Center, WI 53581

Several cases called together:  14CM144 and 15CM8/sentencing after revocation matters with appearances by Defendant Denise J. Varboncoeur in court with attorney Brian Walter Gleason; Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  15CM139, 15CM140, 15CM227, 15CT40, and 16CF47 called together for plea/sentencing with appears by Defendant with attorney Michael Curran; DA Harper for the State.

In the revocation matters, Atty. G argues to the Court re what he believes were deficiencies in the revocation process.

Atty. C suggests that all matters be rescheduled or at least recalled later today.

Matters recalled:

DA Harper recites plea agreement of the parties in the non-revocation cases.

Def pleads guilty to Count 1 in 15CM139 (theft), Count 1 in 15CM140 (concealed weapon), Count 1 in 15CT40 (OWI 2nd), and amended Count 1, Count 2, and Count 3 (drug charge and bail jumping charges) in 16CF47.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Count 1 in 16CF47 amended to 961.573 (1).

Sentences:

15CM139 - Count 1 - 6 months county jail, imposed/stayed for 3 years probation with conditions to include restitution of $2461 to Greenway Manor; if restitution not paid, civil judgment could be ordered; Defense has 30 days to file any challenge to the restitution.  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any educational or treatment programs ordered by agent; complete AODA and follow through with recommendations of counselor; pay costs of the action.

15CM140 - 3 months county jail, consecutive to the 6 months in 15CM139, imposed/stayed for 3 years probation.  Costs. Same conditions of probation.

15CT40 - OWI 2nd - $1429, 10 days jail, 12 mo revocation, 12 mo IID, $69 for blood draw.  Jail is consecutive to any other time def is serving.

16CF47 - Count 1/possession - 30 days jail imposed/stayed for 3 years probation with same terms, along with costs.  Counts 2 and 3 - 3 months county jai each count, imposed/stayed, consecutive, for 3 years probation with same conditions and costs.

15CM227 - dismissed/read-in.  All other counts dismissed/read-in.

Def and Atty. Gleason addresses the Court prior to sentencing after revocation in 14CM144 and 15CM8.

Sentences:

Court orders AODA but does not order ARC. 

6 months county jail on all revoked counts, concurrent, with credit for 136 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Telephone request from Atty Curran re. rescheduling from 05/10/16 to 05/17/16. No objection by DA.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Several cases called together, on the calendar for status and/or plea/sentencing.  Defendant Denise J. Varboncoeur in court with attorney Michael C. Curran. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA notes that def is undergoing revocation in a probation matter; has separate counsel in that case (Atty. Gleason); DA states she wasn't aware that def had two different attorneys; wants a chance to work with all parties towards resolution of all matters.  Court sets plea/sentencing in 15CT40, 15CM140, 16CF47, 15CM139, 15CM227, and status in 15CM8 and 14CM144 (cases subject to potential revocation).  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Denise J. Varboncoeur in court, in custody, with attorney Michael C. Curran. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together for adjourned initial and or status:  16CF47 (AIA/status), 15CT40 (status), 15CM139 (status), 15CM140 (status), and 15CM227 (status).  DA states that the parties are asking for plea/sentencing date; working towards global resolution.  Atty. Curran concurs; asks for a date sooner rather than later.  4/18 at 9:30 set by the Court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Denise J. Varboncoeur in court, in custody, with attorney Michael C. Curran. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together:  status in 15CM140, 15CM227, 15CT40, and 15CM139, and initial appearance in 16CF47.

In 16CF47, Atty. Curran waives formal reading of the charges.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as her rights including right to prelim.  Atty. Curran states defense will waive time limits for the prelim.  Court's colloquy with def re time limits waiver.  

DA states parties will be working towards resolution of all matters; asks for further scheduling sooner rather than later.  Court adjourns all matters to April 7th at 11 a.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.
